scientific_name: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
study_title: RNA-seq to investigate bacterial responses to expression of a sequence-specific mobile DNA methyltransferase
experiment_title: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired end sequencing; Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired end sequencing of SAMD00019994
sample_description: The E. coli strain used was BHY173, a MG1655 derivative with mutations in restriction enzyme genes (genotype: MG1655 delta(mrr-hsdRMS-mcrB) deltamcrA). BHY187: BHY173(pACYC184deltatet).  This strain was grown in Lennox LB up to mid-exponential phase (O.D.600 =0.5) in two different batches. Then cells were harvested for RNA extraction. Total RNA was extracted from cell pellets using PureLink RNA mini kit (Ambion). rRNA was depleted using Ribo-Zero rRNA Removal kit (Gram-negative bacteria)(Epicentre). cDNA library for mRNA-seq was constructed using TruSeq RNA Sample Prep kit (Illumina). The indexed cDNA libraries were pooled and sequenced in HiSeq 2000 platform (Illumina).
description: Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired end sequencing; Illumina HiSeq 2500 paired end sequencing of SAMD00019994

sample_description: This sample has been submitted by Wellcome Sanger Institute on 2014-11-10; Escherichia coli

study_title: RNAseq of uropathogenic E. coli strain EO399, grown in conditions resembling passage through the gut; coli was grown in the presence or absence of 1 of 3 organic acids (acetic, butyric or propionic) at pH5.5 or pH7 and in aerobic or anaerobic conditions
experiment_title: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; RNAseq of uropathogenic E. coli strain EO399, grown in conditions resembling passage through the gut; coli was grown in the presence or absence of 1 of 3 organic acids (acetic, butyric or propionic) at pH5.5 or pH7 and in aerobic or anaerobic conditions
sample_description: Protocols: E. coli cultures were grown overnight, each inoculated from a single colony grown in M9supp Growth was monitored spectroscopically until an OD600 of 1.8 was reached.  A dilution and replenishment protocol was then applied to achieve steady state growth as described previously [37], by removing 5 ml of culture and replacing it with 5 ml of pre-warmed M9supp.  This was done every 30 minutes for an hour for the anaerobic cultures, and every fifteen minutes for the aerobic cultures; pilot experiments established that this maintained the culture density between an OD600 of 1.8 and 2 (data not shown).  To impose the stress, 5 ml of culture was then removed, and 5 ml of pre-warmed M9supp at the appropriate pH with or without additional SCFA were added to create the specific stress condition.  Growth was then continued for 15 minutes.  Five ml of culture were removed from each flask and transferred to an equal amount of Qiagen RNA Protect and mixed thoroughly. Cells were pelleted by spinning at 4000rpm for 5 minutes in a chilled centrifuge, and pellets were stored at -80 C for downstream RNA purification. RNA was purified from the pellets collected as above using Qiagen RNeasy kits according to manufacturer’s instructions.  The optional on-column DNA digestion step was done for all samples to ensure there was no DNA contamination of samples. PCR amplification of the evgS gene was used to confirm the absence of genomic DNA (data not shown). All samples were checked ...
